intro: Chondrosum hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy chondrosum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, giving it its common name, and it produces small, yellow to orange flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Chondrosum hirsutum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
